item.title: New Marvel Fighting Game Confirms Release Date and 4 X-Men for the Roster
item.description:
As many predicted, Arc System Works was on hand during Sony's PlayStation State of Play to reveal new details about the upcoming fighting game, Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls , including the game's launch date. Fans have been starving for new information about the Marvel fighter after earlier reveals of the initial 8 characters and some closed beta tests throughout 2025. With Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls scheduled for a 2026 launch, it was only a matter of time before news finally surfaced.

In fact, new details actually arrived sooner than Sony and Arc System Works probably intended. Following a new PlayStation State of Play announcement for February 12, the Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls Steam page also received a subtle update giving fans new details that had yet to be released. It confirmed a launch roster of 20 heroes, 64 player online lobbies, a PSN account requirement for PC users, as well as a single-player mode that would give players a deep dive into the various teams in the game. With the newly released trailer, the "teams" dynamic is now starting to come into shape.

Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls Release Date

  • August 6, 2026

During Sony's PlayStation State of Play for February 12, 2026, Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls revealed a 2-minute trailer with a ton of new information. Kicking things off on Chandilar, the Shi'ar Homeworld, players saw what appeared to be the bodies of Deathbird and Gladiator before the planet was essentially vaporized. Transitioning to Earth, a purple storm cloud appeared and enveloped the skies, giving fans their first glimpse at the game's overarching story.

From there, the trailer revealed the first complete team of characters, all part of the Unbreakable X-Men. While players have seen Storm in previous Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls trailers, she was joined by Wolverine, Magik, and Danger. While the first three have appeared in plenty of other games and media, Danger is the physical manifestation of the X-Mansion's Danger Room, where Xavier's mutants train. The character first appeared in 2005's Astonishing X-Men (Vol. 3), the room itself was seemingly given life thanks in large part to Shi'ar technology. The trailer highlighted many of the character's impressive super and ultimate attacks, including a huge, stylish teamup that incorporated all four characters.

An accompanying blog post revealed a bit more on the previously announced Episode Mode, a collaboration between ArcSys and Marvel Games to blend American Comics and Japanese Manga to tell the game's story. Motion comics illustrated by celebrated artists will detail the narrative, which is teased to have been written by "a renowned writer from the original Marvel comics."

Fit the 9 games into the grid.

In addition, the reveal also confirmed pre-order bonuses and special editions that players can preorder, starting on February 19 with the game officially launching on August 6. Anyone who preorders the game will unlock lobby cosmetics for their avatar, including an Infinity Gauntlet, a Baby Groot lobby pet, and a ridable Cosmic Surfboard.

For those who want a bit more from the game, there's a Digital Deluxe Edition and Ultimate Edition as well. The Digital Deluxe is priced at $84.99 and will give the player the full Year One Pass, which will add another 4 characters and 1 stage post-launch. In addition, it'll let players dress their avatar up as Howard the Duck and unlock a Cosmo lobby pet.

Finally, the Ultimate Edition will give everything previously announced and more cosmetic gear. For $99.99, players will also receive 5 bonus character costumes like Spider-Man's Advanced Suit 2.0 from Insomniac's Marvel’s Spider-Man 2 game. Players also unlock Storm's Punk Rock outfit, Iron Man and Captain America's Classic Costumes, and Doctor Doom's Supreme Ruler outfit. Finally, all 20 launch characters will have access to an animated chromatic color option.

Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls

item.title: PlayStation Plus Confirms 13 Games Coming Soon, Including a Day 1 Release
item.description:
Sony used a part of its latest PlayStation State of Play event to highlight its PlayStation Plus subscription service, confirming new games on the way for the Essential, Extra, and Premium tiers that are coming in the near future. Sony tends to stick to established patterns when it comes to revealing new batches of PlayStation Plus games, but it broke from tradition when it comes to the February 2026 PS Plus Extra and Premium games.

Everyone was expecting Sony to reveal the PS Plus Extras and Premium games for February 2026 this past Wednesday, February 11. However, the usual time that Sony makes its Extra and Premium announcement came and went without a peep. It was then assumed by many that Sony would be showcasing PS Plus at the February 2026 State of Play event, and as it turns out, that is exactly what happened. Sony used the event to reveal new games that are coming to PS Plus on Tuesday, February 17, as well as some other titles that are coming soon, but that fans will have to wait a little longer for.

Sony specifically highlighted four games at the State of Play, though a later announcement after the show revealed the full line-up of titles coming on February 17, bringing the total number of games announced to 13. The four games at the state of play were headlined by the previously-leaked Marvel's Spider-Man 2 for PS5, giving subscribers of the Extra and Premium tiers the chance to play one of the highest-rated exclusive games on the platform at no additional cost. It was also confirmed that Big Walk would be making its way to the Essential tier, meaning that all PS Plus subscribers will get to play the co-op puzzler on day one of its release. And finally, it was confirmed that classic PSP fighting game Tekken: Dark Resurrection is going to be a part of the PS Plus Extra and Premium lineup for March 2026, while on-rails shooter Time Crisis is coming in May 2026, with motion controls supported.

List of New PS Plus Games Coming Soon

Essential Tier

  • Big Walk - TBA 2026

Extra Tier

  • Echoes of the End: Enhanced Edition (PS5) - February 17
  • Marvel's Spider-Man 2 (PS5) - February 17
  • Monster Hunter Stories (PS4) - February 17
  • Monster Hunter Stories 2: Wings of Ruin (PS4) - February 17
  • Neva (PS4/PS5) - February 17
  • Rugby 25 (PS4/PS5) - February 17
  • Season: A Letter to the Future (PS4/PS5) - February 17
  • Test Drive Unlimited Solar Crown (PS5) - February 17
  • Venba (PS5) - February 17

Premium Tier

  • Disney Pixar Wall-E (PS4/PS5) - February 17
  • Tekken: Dark Resurrection - March 2026
  • Time Crisis - May 2026

After the show was over, Sony took the time to announce the new games coming to the Extra and Premium tiers as part of the February 2026 lineup. Besides Spider-Man 2 , February 17 will also see Echoes of the End: Enhanced Edition , Monster Hunter Stories , Monster Hunter Stories 2: Wings of Ruin , Neva , Rugby 25 , Season: A Letter to the Future , Test Drive Unlimited Solar Crown , and Venba hit the Extra tier, while Disney Pixar Wall-E will be coming to the Premium tier.

Some of the new PS Plus games coming in February 2026 definitely seem strategically picked. The Monster Hunter Stories games are coming just as Capcom is releasing a brand-new Monster Hunter Stories game, so perhaps putting the earlier games on PS Plus will convince more people to go out and buy the new one. Plus, a new Neva game was announced at the show, and so it makes sense that the original is being added to the Extra tier of PS Plus.

There's a lot coming to PS Plus on February 17, but subscribers should know that there are games leaving PS Plus that same day. Needless to say, subscribers should plan accordingly.

9 /10

item.title: How to Start Up All Mall Generators in Romeo Is A Dead Man (Chapter 2)
item.description:
Once players make it to the Deadford Shopping Mall in Romeo is a Dead Man chapter 2, they'll need to start up three generators. Doing this is important to increase the max power output of the mall to find the singularity that resides within. While two of the generators are easy to find, players will need to do a bit of Subspace jumping to find the third and final one. Here's a quick guide on how you can start up all three generators in Romeo is a Dead Man .

How to Start Up All Three Mall Generators in Romeo is a Dead Man (Chapter 2: Hubris)

Once players enter the Deadford Shopping Mall, they'll need to quickly eliminate a swarm of enemies in front of them to activate the primary generator . This will restore power to the mall and activate the lighting system.

From here, simply move further into the mall, and you'll spot a purple Tesseract in front of a glowing white portal. Grab the Tesseract to get an Exorcist Sword - Gold . This is a key item that you'll need to remove the white portal (Liminal Wall) and access a new area.

Now, head upstairs to the second floor from the location of the first generator to open the shutter to a shop. This will reveal the first generator you'll need to activate, but you'll need to defeat a large monster called Flab first. Once the Flab and other enemies are taken care of, activate the generator.

While staying on the first floor, head to the center of the mall, and you'll spot a cage on the first floor with a generator inside . Since you can't access the generator from there, you'll need to use the wooden boards to jump into the cage from the second floor.

Once you're down, you'll need to defeat Tomato Head and a new quadruped enemy called Gecko. Once the area is clear of enemies, activate the second generator, and a Subspace television will appear once you're done. Use the TV to teleport to Subspace.

Once you arrive in Subspace, head up the stairs in front of you, and you'll arrive on the second floor of the Subspace version of the mall. Look to the left and jump down the railing to arrive at the first floor. Keep heading further and turn left to spot a glowing white liminal wall across the glass double doors .

GR Report: Subscribe and never miss what matters

Level up your gaming knowledge with GameRant, packed with news, reviews, and insights from the gaming world.
By subscribing, you agree to receive newsletter and marketing emails, and accept our Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You can unsubscribe anytime.

Use the Exorcist Sword - Gold to destroy the Liminal Wall and access the area behind it. Keep following the shifting hallway to reach a new Subspace TV that you can interact with to reach the storage section of the Deadford Mall .

Keep following the pathway heading through the storage shelves, and you'll eventually reach the third generator . Defeat any enemies around the generator and switch it on to complete the main objective of Romeo is a Dead Man, chapter 2. Now that you have all the generators activated, use the Subspace TV and go through the maze-like structure to continue with the chapter.

Romeo is a Dead Man

item.title: Xbox Game Pass Subscribers Can Play 4 Games for Free Until February 15
item.description:
Xbox Game Pass has provided its subscribers a handful of free games, available to install and play until February 15. The titles are available to Xbox Game Pass members of all tiers as a part of the company's Free Play Days, which promises to add new, free titles for subscribers to try on a weekly basis.

Xbox Game Pass has been a staple of Microsoft's gaming strategy since its introduction in June 2017. The subscription service, which provides players with a large selection of Xbox titles to play on demand, officially absorbed Xbox Live Gold, Xbox's previous online subscription that was required to play most titles online, in 2023. In addition to a rotating library of previously released games, Xbox Game Pass' inclusion of day-one releases have become a primary driving factor for fans to remain subscribed, with the majority of Microsoft's biggest upcoming titles confirmed to be releasing on the service such as Fable and Forza Horizon 6 .

Xbox Game Pass Adds Four Free Titles to Try for Free

  • NHL 26
  • Sword Art Online: Fractured Daydream
  • Lynked: Banner of the Spark (Game Pass Membership Required)
  • Age of Wonders 4 (Game Pass Membership Required)

Xbox has added four titles to its Free Play Days, available for Xbox players to try out for free until February 15. NHL 26 and Sword Art Online: Fractured Daydream are a part of Free Play Days For All, making them freely available for all Xbox players to give a try, while Lynked: Banner of the Spark and Age of Wonders 4 will require an Xbox Game Pass membership to play. The latter two games are available for members of all three tiers of Xbox Game Pass, giving all subscribers of the service something new to play.

Rearrange the covers into the correct US release order.

More Games

More Games

NHL 26 is the most recent title among the bunch, with the latest edition of EA's premiere hockey game series having been released in late 2025. This entry in the franchise features a series of updates to the NHL series formula, including revamped live service elements and an improved Ice-Q 2.0 system. The improved technology allows players in NHL 26 to benefit from advanced stat tracking and performance analysis based on the NHL's EDGE data tracking services. The title also introduces a host of changes to its Be A Pro career mode.

Launched in May 2023 , Age of Wonders 4 is Triumph Studios' well-received, high fantasy-themed 4X strategy title. The game's release comes nearly 10 years after it's predecessor, Age of Wonders 3, with a host of improvements to its complex but engaging turn-based strategy combat. The game has received continuous support since its debut, with numerous expansions and content packs already available. The game has multiple additional expansions scheduled to be released throughout the first half of 2026, making this a great time for new players to give this strategy title a try.

Lynked: Banner of the Spark is a 2024 roguelite game that features a unique blend of genres, incorporating life-sim elements in addition to its dungeon exploration. Set in the far future, players will attempt to quest through dangerous landscapes, battling hosts of robotic enemies before returning to town to assist in rebuilding their village. Also released in 2024, Sword Art Online: Fractured Daydream is an expansive RPG set in an altered version of the popular Sword Art Online universe. The game features both an expansive single-player adventure and an online co-op mode, allowing players to team up with up to 20 others across the world to participate in massive raids. Fans of the series will have the opportunity to team up with their favorite characters in their quest to restore order to the world's fractured timeline. With such a wide variety of titles available, Xbox fans will have plenty to play throughout the month of February.

NHL 26

item.title: 8 Best Xbox Games Like Nioh
item.description:
Nioh 3 is performing quite well in terms of sales and overall review progress. As the third game in a series, things can easily turn out badly in every way, which is why it’s so great to see that Team Ninja and Koei Tecmo didn’t shove out a sequel without thinking about it.

Thanks to some gameplay changes, like the open-field design and new Ninja Style, Nioh 3 is shaping up to be an accessible Soulslike. For any Xbox player who is looking for similar games to play after featuring ninjas or samurai, or are action RPGs or Soulslikes, then these are some top recommendations.

Click or tap on the games that match the category

Category: —
Time: 30s
Combo: 0 • x1.00

Round 1

The category for round 1 is …

5

Results

0
—
More Games

Ninja Gaiden 4

Ryu Vs Yakumo

Ninja Gaiden 4
9 /10
Released
October 21, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Platinum Games, Team Ninja, Koei Tecmo Games Co., Ltd.
Genre(s)
Action, Adventure, Hack and Slash
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, PC
Powered by

Nioh 3 is being compared a lot to the Ninja Gaiden series for good reason, since Team Ninja developed both, or at least the 3D games. Ninja Gaiden 4 is the latest entry, featuring a new protagonist, Yakumo, alongside some levels that feature the franchise’s mainstay, Ryu.

It’s the perfect jumping-on point since it is the latest game and because there is a new character to sort of reset the pace. Any 3D entry is a good recommendation for those who love the Ninja Style of Nioh 3 . Ninja Gaiden 4 isn’t a Soulslike, but it is a hardcore game filled with fast action, deadly moves, and excellent platforming that is just as good as the combat.

Elden Ring

Taking It On The Road

Elden Ring
10 /10
Released
February 25, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Genre(s)
RPG, Action
Powered by

Elden Ring has been a hard game to top since it was released in 2022. It was the first Soulslike that had a true open-world to explore, opening up the possibilities for players to tackle the various areas and bosses in any order. If one area/boss was too challenging, players could explore elsewhere or just grind until they felt strong enough.

With various builds, players could also create something memorable for themselves, either alone or with friends online, plus exploration was so much more fulfilling because of the horse, Torrent. As challenging as it is, this open-ended nature and deep customization options helped make it one of FromSoftware’s most accessible titles, just like Nioh 3 is for Team Ninja.

Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice

The Wolf Howls

Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice
Released
March 22, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
From Software
Genre(s)
Action RPG
Platform(s)
PS4, PC, Xbox One
Powered by

Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice is the exact opposite of Elden Ring because it is the hardest game FromSoftware has ever made. It’s also not technically a Soulslike because there are few progression systems in the game beyond some light upgrades. That means it’s all about skill, and Nioh 3 fans will feel right at home with the combat.

Wolf is a ninja who survived a fatal blow and got a prosthetic arm in the process, which can be exchanged for various upgrades like a flamethrower. Players also get a katana, a grappling hook to escape or sneak around higher grounds, and other various ninja tools. Stealth is important along with both active and reactive skills, so the challenge is waiting in Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice .

Monster Hunter Rise

It’s Raining Ninja Dogs And Cats!

Monster Hunter Rise
9 /10
Released
March 26, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Capcom
Genre(s)
Action, RPG
Platform(s)
Switch, PC, PS5, PS4, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One
Powered by

Monster Hunter Rise started as a Switch exclusive entry in the series before getting an Xbox One port. Unlike most entries in the series that are all about fantasy, this one has a retro Japanese aesthetic with samurai and ninja designs for the characters and central village. Also, along with the classic cat companions, Palicos, players can also customize a dog friend called a Palamute, which was a first for the franchise.

Palamutes can be ridden in levels, and both pets can assist players in battle if they are hunting monsters solo. The Monster Hunter series is known for its great difficulty, even though it isn’t a Soulslike. By slaying boss-like monsters, players can use parts to craft new weapons and armor to get more powerful. For Nioh fans in general, this is an easy one to recommend since it does have similar theming around ancient Japan.

Wo Long: Fallen Dynasty

Dynasty Warriors As A Soulslike

Wo Long: Fallen Dynasty
8 /10
Released
March 3, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Team Ninja
Genre(s)
Action RPG
Platform(s)
PS5, PS4, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, PC
Powered by

Wo Long: Fallen Dynasty is the Chinese equivalent of the Nioh games, basing its characters and ancient demons around Chinese mythology and history. Fans of the Dynasty Warriors series will feel at home as the game shares some familiar historical faces like Lu Bu and Guan Yu, plus it’s another Soulslike from Team Ninja. Players can create their character and level them up at rest areas and find loot along the way.

The action is fast-paced and freeform, like the Ninja Style of Nioh 3 , instead of being clunkier and defense-heavy like in Dark Souls . Also, players going at it alone can partner with up to two allies who are named characters instead of being the spirits of random players like in Nioh 3’s Benevolent Graves. Players can even improve their bonds with allies in Wo Long: Fallen Dynasty , and get bonuses like the Social Links system of the Persona series.

Assassin’s Creed Shadows

Two Classes Via Two Characters

Assassin's Creed Shadows
9 /10
Released
March 20, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Ubisoft Quebec
Genre(s)
Action, Stealth, RPG
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, PC
Powered by

Assassin’s Creed Shadows is the latest Assassin’s Creed game, which finally sets itself in ancient Japan, and features a fully open-world to explore. Players get two characters to play, and after a brief few hours of setup, they can swap between them before missions. Naoe is a nimble female ninja who can sneak up on enemies and assassinate them with ease, but if things get hectic, she can also hold her own in direct combat.

Yasuke is a male samurai who is built like an ox, strong enough to wield bigger weapons and even smash through gates. Technically, players can use stealth with Yasuke too, but he’s not as nimble or as quiet. There are pros and cons to Naoe and Yasuke in Assassin’s Creed Shadows , and players will have to strategize which characters fit the given mission best. Like Nioh 3 , players can level up both characters and outfit them with various armor sets and weapons.

Onimusha 2: Samurai's Destiny

Summoning The Power Of Demons

Onimusha 2: Samurai's Destiny (2025)
8 /10
Released
May 23, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Capcom
Genre(s)
Action, Hack and Slash, Survival Horror
Platform(s)
PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch, PC
Powered by

Onimusha 2: Samurai's Destiny is a remaster of the PS2 original game that doesn’t change much, beyond improving controls, which is for the better. This survival horror game is set in ancient Japan, starring a samurai, Jubei Yagyu, who is part of a mystic clan that can harness the power of benevolent demons. With magic weapons, from swords to spears, players can slay demons with elemental attacks and even transform into a temporary demon state like the Living Artifacts in Nioh 3 .

GR Report: Subscribe and never miss what matters

Level up your gaming knowledge with GameRant, packed with news, reviews, and insights from the gaming world.
By subscribing, you agree to receive newsletter and marketing emails, and accept our Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You can unsubscribe anytime.

Players can also befriend allies, and depending on story choices, they can even play some of them temporarily. Onimusha 2: Samurai's Destiny's combat is a bit more basic compared to any of the Nioh games, but there are counters, and the quick runtime will be an easy one to shake off over a weekend, which makes this PS2 classic worth revisiting on Xbox hardware.

Dragon’s Dogma 2

Soulslike In Spirit

Dragon's Dogma 2
9 /10
Released
March 22, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Capcom
Genre(s)
Action RPG
Platform(s)
PC, PS5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

Dragon’s Dogma 2 is an open-world action RPG set in a medieval fantasy world filled with goblins, dragons, and various other monsters. It may not exactly fit the vibe of Nioh series, but the extreme difficulty will certainly give players a run for their money. With their customizable hero and companion, called a Pawn, players can fill out their party with warriors, archers, mages, and the like, and explore the world.

One of the coolest mechanics lets players grab smaller monsters or climb on top of big ones. Picking up a goblin instead of stabbing it and then throwing it off a gorge can create endless hours of fun. Dragon’s Dogma 2 can take a while to get used to, more so than other action RPGs, but if players keep at it, they’ll be rewarded handsomely with a unique experience.
